topic.title: A possible explanation of Trump's erratic post-election behavior
topic.body:
Via [wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paradise_Syndrome):

> a condition in which a person suffers a feeling of dissatisfaction despite having achieved all their dreams

Also expressible with the phrase "...now what?", I feel like this is what Trump is experiencing right now. I doubt he really intended to win in the first place. He may have intended to loose and launch a news empire to rival the likes of even Fox and Breitbart--remaining the underdog fighting against _the man_, and corralling followers by that fact alone (It's not that far-fetched; he's had years of acting experience). But now he has **become** the man, and no longer has that advantage. He now has to be the very thing he's styled himself as fighting against.


In a sense, everyone has called his bluff by electing him. He no longer has Hillary to blame for things, and is suddenly accountable for things in a way he wasn't before. He's put [an awful lot](https://trumptracker.github.io/) on his plate. It's time to see how much he finishes.

1_18NsJqjikBYBjwLzMVp7aBJSpqtyRSd9qF.body:
> [1488475982](#comment_1_1B53QF3NE5rsWF3d2kYa6mT1EmfzRSAZiV): Could that explain his many lies?

Unlikely, since he has been lying from very early on. This one's harder to explain.
